intro: Gonzalagunia mollis, commonly known as the silky gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Gonzalagunia mollis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential ecological and medicinal properties.
